sentences.en: A brief rest restored the traveller's vigour.
sentences.cn: 经过短暂的休息,那些旅行者又恢复了精力.

sentences.en: A brisk massage restores the body's vigour.
sentences.cn: 轻快的按摩能恢复体力.

sentences.en: A succinct style lends vigour to writing.
At 40, he was in his prime and full of vigour.
He began working with renewed vigour.
sentences.cn: 他以更加旺盛的精力开始工作。

sentences.en: He blew his nose with great vigour.
He bounded up the step with vigour.
sentences.cn: 他精神十足地跳上一级台阶.

sentences.en: He has approached his job with renewed vigour.
sentences.cn: 他已带着重新焕发的活力投入了工作。

sentences.en: He worked with renewed vigour and determination.
sentences.cn: 他以新的活力和决心工作着。

sentences.en: In real-life, the band have memorable songs and a stage vigour that enthrals.
sentences.cn: 在现实生活中，这支乐队的一些歌曲令人难忘，他们的舞台魅力令人着迷。

sentences.en: She has the vigour and radiance of someone young enough to be her grand-daughter.
sentences.cn: 她拥有与孙女辈的年轻人一样的活力和容光。

sentences.en: She is full of vigour and enthusiasm.
Sun Wukong , his face lit up with youthful vigour, climbed up onto his throne.
sentences.cn: 孙悟空春风满面, 高登宝座.

sentences.en: The campaign to wipe out illiteracy launched out with great vigour.
sentences.cn: 扫盲运动生气勃勃地展开了.

sentences.en: The choir sang out the two words with great vigour.
sentences.cn: 合唱团把这两个字唱得十分有力.

sentences.en: This law is still in vigour.
This young fellow does his work with vim and vigour.

trans.tran_cn: 精力，活力，气势，强健，有力行动
trans.tran_en: physical or mental energy and determination
